summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the death of Jeffrey Epstein in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center. The statement confirms the ongoing investigation into sex trafficking of minors and urges victims to come forward.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the official statement on the death of Jeffrey Epstein, confirming the event and reiterating the ongoing investigation into sex trafficking charges.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The accused who faced federal charges for sex trafficking of minors; found unresponsive in his cell and pronounced dead.

connections.description: Berman, as the U.S. Attorney, was the lead prosecutor bringing federal charges against Epstein for sex trafficking.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center and pronounced dead shortly thereafter.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center on the morning of August 9, 2019.
Epstein was facing federal charges brought by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for sex trafficking of minors, including a conspiracy count.
The U.S. Attorney's Office stated the investigation into the conduct charged in the indictment remains ongoing despite Epstein's death.
The statement directly addresses and urges 'brave young women' who may be victims to come forward and contact the FBI.
